issuers.tagline: AI safety and research company developing reliable AI systems
issuers.description: Anthropic is an AI safety and research company founded in 2021 by former OpenAI executives. It focuses on building reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems, with its flagship product being the Claude family of large language models. The company emphasizes AI alignment with human values and has rapidly grown to become a key player in the AI industry. As of September 2025, Anthropic has achieved an implied valuation of approximately $183 billion following its $13 billion Series F funding round. It serves millions of users and generates significant revenue through API access and enterprise solutions.

products.name: Claude AI models: Opus 4.1 (most intelligent), Sonnet 4 with 1M context (limited/beta).
API for developers: Build AI-powered applications with Claude.
Claude Code: Specialized for coding tasks and software engineering.
Research in interpretability, alignment, and societal impacts.
Enterprise solutions: Including financial services and compliance tools.

highlights: Raised $13B in Series F at $183B valuation, led by Iconiq.
Launched Claude Opus 4.1, the most advanced model.
Released Claude Sonnet 4 with up to 1M-token context (limited/beta availability).
Invested in
Achieved $5B+ ARR in August 2025, projecting $9B by year-end.
Published research on agentic misalignment and economic impacts.
Expanded Claude Enterprise with new admin and compliance features.

issuers.tagline: AI-powered humanoid robotics company developing general-purpose robots to work alongside humans
issuers.description: Apptronik is a human-centered robotics company developing AI-powered humanoid robots designed to work alongside humans in critical industries. Founded in 2016 as a spinout from the Human Centered Robotics Lab at the University of Texas at Austin, the company has developed 15 robotic systems including NASA's Valkyrie humanoid robot. Apptronik's flagship product, Apollo, is a general-purpose humanoid robot that stands 5'8" tall, weighs 160 pounds, and can lift up to 55 pounds. Apollo is designed for seamless collaboration in logistics, manufacturing, and retail, with future applications in healthcare, eldercare, and beyond. In February 2025, Apptronik raised a $350 million Series A round (expanded to $403 million) co-led by B Capital and Capital Factory, with participation from Google, Mercedes-Benz, ARK Invest, and others, bringing total funding to $436 million and has secured strategic partnerships with Google DeepMind for AI integration, NVIDIA for Project GR00T, Mercedes-Benz for manufacturing pilots, and GXO Logistics for warehouse applications.

products.name: Apollo: General-purpose humanoid robot (5'8", 160 lbs, 55 lbs payload capacity)
Proprietary Linear Actuators: Custom electric actuators serving as mechanical muscles
Modular Design: Torso can be mounted on wheels, stationary, or bipedal legs
Swappable Batteries: 4-hour runtime per battery pack for continuous operation
Force Control Architecture: Safe collaborative operation around humans
AI Integration: Google DeepMind Gemini Robotics for enhanced adaptability
Full-Stack Development: In-house hardware, electronics, firmware, software, AI

highlights: Raised $403M Series A at $1.5B valuation (Feb-Mar 2025)
Valuation increased to $5B in follow-on round (Aug 2025)

issuers.tagline: Cyber exposure management and security company protecting the entire attack surface in real-time
issuers.description: Armis is the cyber exposure management and security company founded in 2016 by Yevgeny Dibrov and Nadir Izrael. The company protects the entire attack surface and manages cyber risk exposure in real-time from ground to cloud for critical infrastructure worldwide. Powered by the AI-driven Asset Intelligence Engine, Armis Centrix™ delivers continuous visibility, intelligence, and control across every asset and environment. As of November 2025, Armis has achieved a valuation of $6.1 billion following a pre-IPO funding round led by Goldman Sachs Alternatives. With over $300 million in annual recurring revenue and growing at over 50%, Armis serves more than 40% of Fortune 100 companies including 7 of the Fortune 10. The company secures leading organizations across manufacturing, airlines, financial services, healthcare, critical infrastructure, and state and federal agencies worldwide.

products.name: Armis Centrix™: AI-driven cyber exposure management platform providing real-time visibility and control.
Armis Centrix™ for OT/IoT Security: Comprehensive protection for operational technology and IoT devices.
Asset Management & Security: Discover all assets including IT, IoT, cloud, managed and unmanaged devices.
Vulnerability Prioritization & Remediation: Consolidate, prioritize and remediate vulnerabilities based on business risk.
Medical Device Security: Complete visibility and security for healthcare ecosystems and IoMT devices.
Early Warning Intelligence: AI-powered threat intelligence to anticipate and mitigate cyber risks.
Attack Path Mapping: Advanced analysis identifying potential attack vectors and exploitation pathways.

highlights: Achieved $6.1B valuation in pre-IPO round led by Goldman Sachs Alternatives (Nov 2025).
Raised $435M in funding with participation from CapitalG and Evolution Equity Partners.

issuers.tagline: Building America's grid for the future with distributed battery-powered home energy

issuers.description: Base Power Company is a Texas-based energy company founded in 2023 by Zach Dell and Justin Lopas. The company is building America's next-generation power grid through a network of distributed residential battery storage systems. Base is the first and only retail electricity provider in Texas offering customers home batteries, monthly energy service, and installation all in one package. The company's mission is to advance human prosperity through energy abundance by delivering reliable and affordable power. As of October 2025, Base has raised $1.275 billion in total funding at a $3 billion valuation and has deployed over 100 MWh of residential battery capacity, making it one of the fastest-scaling distributed energy platforms in the United States.

products.name: Residential battery systems: 25 kWh and 50 kWh options providing up to 48 hours of backup power.
Retail electricity service: Below-market-average rates with transparent pricing and no hidden fees.
Grid-balancing software: Proprietary platform for sub-second fleet management and optimization.
Virtual Power Plant (VPP): Aggregated distributed energy resources for grid stability.

issuers.tagline: Electric aerospace manufacturer developing vertical and conventional takeoff aircraft for sustainable aviation
keyInvestors: Amazon (10.2% stake via Climate Pledge Fund)
issuers.description: Beta Technologies is a Vermont-based aerospace manufacturer founded in 2017 by Kyle Clark, developing electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) and electric conventional takeoff and landing (eCTOL) aircraft. The company's mission is to create sustainable aviation solutions for cargo, medical, passenger, and military applications. Beta has developed two main aircraft models: the ALIA A250 eVTOL and ALIA CX300 eCTOL, both optimized for payload and range. In November 2025, Beta went public on the NYSE, raising over $1 billion at a valuation of $7.4 billion. With nearly 83,000 nautical miles of flight testing completed and over 900 aircraft orders from global operators including UPS, Air New Zealand, United Therapeutics, and the U.S. Department of Defense, Beta is pioneering the future of electric aviation. The company has also developed an extensive charging infrastructure network with over 50 operational charging stations across the United States.

products.name: ALIA A250 eVTOL: Electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft with 250 NM range and 1,250 lbs payload capacity.
ALIA CX300 eCTOL: Electric conventional takeoff and landing aircraft for regional flights with 5 passengers or cargo.
Electric Propulsion Systems: Advanced high-performance electric motors and battery systems.
Charging Infrastructure: UL-certified multimodal charging systems compatible with aircraft and ground EVs.
Fly-by-Wire Systems: Advanced flight control systems for enhanced safety and reliability.
Pilot Training Programs: Comprehensive training for electric aircraft pilots and maintainers.

highlights: Completed IPO on NYSE, raised $1B at $7.4B valuation (Nov 2025).
Raised $318M Series C led by Qatar Investment Authority (Oct 2024).

issuers.tagline: Enterprise AI company building secure, scalable language models and agentic AI platforms
issuers.description: Cohere is a Canadian artificial intelligence company founded in 2019 by former Google Brain researchers, including Aidan Gomez, co-author of the transformative "Attention Is All You Need" paper. The company specializes in developing enterprise-focused large language models and AI platforms that prioritize data security and privacy. Unlike consumer-facing competitors, Cohere focuses exclusively on B2B solutions, offering cloud-agnostic, customizable AI that can be deployed on-premises or in private clouds. As of September 2025, Cohere has achieved a $7 billion valuation and serves hundreds of enterprise clients including Oracle, RBC, McKinsey, and government agencies worldwide.

products.name: North Platform: Enterprise AI workspace with secure agents, search, and automations.
Command Models: High-performance LLMs optimized for enterprise reasoning and agentic AI.
Embed & Rerank: Advanced retrieval and search models for RAG applications.
Aya Vision: Multimodal AI model for image understanding and multilingual tasks.
API Platform: Cloud-agnostic deployment with private cloud and on-premise options.
Cohere For AI: Nonprofit research lab advancing open multilingual AI.

highlights: Raised $600M total in 2025, reaching $7B valuation with BDC and Nexxus joining.
Launched North platform for secure enterprise AI agents and automations.
Released Command A models optimized for agentic AI and enterprise reasoning.

Opened offices in Paris (EMEA hub), Montreal, and expanded to South Korea.
Achieved $200M+ ARR target with major clients like Oracle, Dell, and LG.

issuers.tagline: World's first de-extinction company developing genetic engineering to revive extinct species
issuers.description: Colossal Biosciences is a groundbreaking biotechnology company founded in 2021 by entrepreneur Ben Lamm and Harvard geneticist George Church. Based in Dallas, Texas, it focuses on de-extinction projects to bring back extinct species like the woolly mammoth, Tasmanian tiger (thylacine), and dodo bird using advanced CRISPR gene-editing technology. As of September 2025, Colossal has reached a $10.3 billion valuation following additional Series C funding, becoming Texas' first "decacorn." The company employs over 170 scientists across facilities in Dallas, Boston, and Melbourne, developing technologies with applications beyond de-extinction including species preservation, artificial wombs, and human healthcare.

products.name: De-extinction projects: Woolly mammoth (target 2028), Tasmanian tiger, dodo bird
CRISPR gene-editing technology for species restoration
Artificial womb technology development for conservation
Genetic rescue programs for endangered species
Spin-off companies: Form Bio (computational biology), Breaking (plastic degradation)

highlights: Raised $320M total in Series C at $10.3B valuation (September 2025)
First de-extinction company to achieve "decacorn" status ($10B+ valuation)

Plans to spin off three additional businesses in next two years

issuers.tagline: The AI-native code editor built to accelerate software development and empower the next generation of programmers
issuers.description: Cursor is an AI-powered code editor developed by Anysphere, founded in 2022 by four MIT graduates: Michael Truell, Sualeh Asif, Arvid Lunnemark, and Aman Sanger. Built as a fork of Visual Studio Code, Cursor transforms traditional coding into an intelligent, AI-assisted experience that developers describe as "vibe coding." The platform integrates advanced AI models from OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google to provide context-aware code completion, intelligent rewrites, natural language editing, and autonomous debugging. Since launching in 2023, Cursor has become the fastest-growing SaaS company ever, reaching $100 million in ARR within just 12 months and achieving a $29.3 billion valuation by November 2025. With over 1 million users including more than half of the Fortune 500 companies like Nvidia, Uber, Adobe, Spotify, and OpenAI itself, Cursor is revolutionizing how software is built in the AI era.

products.name: Cursor IDE: AI-native code editor built on VS Code with full extension compatibility.
Tab AI (Fusion): Next-action prediction with context-aware code completion and intelligent cursor jumps.
Cursor Agents: Autonomous coding assistants that can build features, fix bugs, and run tests.
Composer: Multi-file editing and code generation with natural language commands.
Cmd+K: Inline code editing and rewriting with AI assistance.
Chat: Conversational interface for asking questions about codebases and documentation.
Codebase Understanding: Context-aware AI that comprehends entire projects regardless of scale.
Multi-Model Support: Access to GPT-5, Claude Sonnet 4.5, Claude Opus 4.1, Gemini 2.5 Pro, and more.

Introduced in-house coding models reducing dependence on third-party AI.
Rejected acquisition offers from OpenAI to remain independent.

issuers.tagline: Data and AI company powering analytics and AI applications with unified data lakehouse platform
issuers.description: Databricks is a leading data and AI company founded in 2013 by the creators of Apache Spark. The company provides a unified Data Intelligence Platform that enables organizations to democratize access to data and AI, making it easier to harness the power of their data for analytics and AI applications. As of November 2025, Databricks is in talks to raise funding at a valuation exceeding $130 billion, representing a 30% increase from its September 2025 Series K round at $100 billion. With over 15,000 customers including 60% of the Fortune 500, Databricks has become the cornerstone of enterprise data and AI infrastructure, generating over $4 billion in annual revenue run-rate with 50% year-over-year growth and positive free cash flow.

issuers.tagline: All-in-one global HR and payroll platform simplifying international workforce management and compliance
issuers.description: Deel is an all-in-one global HR and payroll platform founded in 2019 by Alex Bouaziz, Shuo Wang, and Ofer Simon. The company revolutionizes how businesses hire, manage, and pay international teams by providing comprehensive solutions for contractor management, employer of record services, global payroll, and HR management across 150+ countries. As of October 2025, Deel has achieved a valuation of $17.3 billion following a $300 million Series E funding round, making it one of the fastest-growing HR tech companies globally. With over $1 billion in annual recurring revenue and serving 37,000+ businesses including Shopify, Nike, Reddit, and Cloudflare, Deel processes $22 billion in payroll annually for 1.5 million workers worldwide. The company owns and operates 150+ local entities globally, providing native payroll infrastructure rather than relying on third-party partners.

issuers.tagline: AI-powered legal technology transforming personal injury law with intelligent case management
issuers.description: EvenUp is a pioneering legal technology company founded in 2019 that leverages artificial intelligence to revolutionize personal injury law. The company's mission is to close the justice gap by empowering personal injury attorneys and their clients to achieve fairer outcomes faster. EvenUp's Claims Intelligence Platform, powered by its proprietary Piai AI model, is trained on hundreds of thousands of injury cases and millions of medical records. As of October 2025, EvenUp has achieved a valuation exceeding $2 billion and has helped resolve over 200,000 cases, securing more than $10 billion in damages for injury victims. The company serves over 2,000 law firms, including 20% of the top 100 US personal injury firms, with ARR doubling year-over-year.

issuers.tagline: AI robotics company building autonomous humanoid robots for industry and home
issuers.description: Figure AI is an AI robotics company founded in 2022 by serial entrepreneur Brett Adcock. The company develops autonomous humanoid robots designed to address labor shortages and automate dangerous or repetitive tasks across manufacturing, logistics, and domestic environments. With its flagship Figure 02 robot and revolutionary Helix Vision-Language-Action model, Figure has rapidly emerged as a leader in humanoid robotics. The company achieved a $39 billion valuation in September 2025 following over $1 billion in Series C funding, backed by major investors including Microsoft, NVIDIA, OpenAI, and Jeff Bezos.

products.name: Figure 02: Second-generation humanoid with 50% more battery, 6 RGB cameras, 16 DoF hands.
Helix VLA: First commercial-ready Vision-Language-Action model for humanoid control.
Full upper-body control at 200Hz with onboard GPUs.
Multi-robot collaboration and natural language understanding.

issuers.tagline: AI inference cloud platform enabling developers and enterprises to build, fine-tune, and scale optimized generative AI applications
keyInvestors: Sheryl Sandberg, Frank Slootman, Alexandr Wang
issuers.description: Fireworks AI is a generative AI inference platform founded in 2022 by the team behind Meta's PyTorch. Led by CEO Lin Qiao, who previously headed PyTorch at Meta, the company was created to democratize access to high-performance AI infrastructure. Fireworks enables developers and enterprises to deploy, fine-tune, and scale open-source AI models with exceptional speed and cost efficiency. The platform processes over 10 trillion tokens daily for more than 10,000 customers, including leading companies like Uber, DoorDash, Shopify, Cursor, and GitLab. In October 2025, Fireworks achieved a $4 billion valuation following a $250 million Series C funding round, establishing itself as a leader in the AI inference market. The company's mission is to enable automated product-model co-design, allowing businesses to optimize for quality, speed, and cost simultaneously through compound AI systems and continuous model improvement.

products.name: Fireworks Inference Platform: Fastest AI inference cloud with 99.99% uptime.
Access to 100+ Open-Source Models: Text, image, audio, and multimodal formats.
Speculative Decoding API: Enables 1000+ tokens/sec for code generation.
FireAttention v2: Leading low-latency inference engine with 8x speed improvements.
Fine-Tuning Tools: LoRA, reinforcement learning, and quantization-aware tuning.

issuers.tagline: Leading provider of autonomous systems for ground-based defense and industrial operations
issuers.description: Forterra (formerly Robotic Research) is a pioneering autonomous systems company founded in 2002 by Alberto Lacaze and Karl Murphy. Headquartered in Clarksburg, Maryland, Forterra develops groundbreaking autonomous driving technology for defense and industrial applications. The company's flagship AutoDrive® platform enables self-driving capabilities across diverse vehicle types, from small robotic platforms to 80-ton industrial tractors, operating in the most demanding environments including GPS-denied, off-road terrain. Forterra is the only company competing on all four Department of Defense ground autonomy programs and is currently producing driverless vehicles for the military. In November 2025, the company achieved unicorn status with a $1 billion+ valuation following a $238 million Series C funding round. With hundreds of autonomous systems deployed globally, Forterra is setting the standard for mission-critical autonomy in defense and industrial sectors.

issuers.tagline: AI-powered presentation platform transforming how ideas are created and shared visually
issuers.description: Gamma is an AI-powered presentation platform founded in late 2020 by Grant Lee, Jon Noronha, and James Fox, former colleagues from Optimizely. The company reimagines how presentations, documents, and websites are created by leveraging artificial intelligence to eliminate the need for design skills or complex formatting. Gamma transforms rough ideas into polished visual content in seconds, using an agentic design partner approach. As of November 2025, Gamma has achieved a $2.1 billion valuation following a $68 million Series B funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz. The platform serves 70 million users globally who have created over 400 million presentations, websites, and documents, generating more than 1 million pieces of content daily. Remarkably, Gamma has been profitable since early 2024, achieving $100 million in ARR with only a 50-person team.

products.name: AI Presentations: Transform prompts into beautiful slide decks instantly.
Interactive Documents: Create engaging memos, briefs, and reports with embedded media.
Website Builder: Generate responsive, mobile-friendly websites without coding.
Smart Templates: One-click restyle with flexible, expert-level design layouts.
Rich Media Embeds: Integrate Figma, Loom, Airtable, Google Drive, YouTube, and more.
AI Content Generation: Autocomplete, rewrite, and enhance content with AI assistance.
Analytics Dashboard: Track audience engagement and presentation performance.

issuers.tagline: AI hardware company building Language Processing Units (LPUs) for ultra-fast AI inference
issuers.description: Groq is an AI hardware company founded in 2016 by former Google engineers, led by Jonathan Ross, one of the designers of Google's TPU. The company develops Language Processing Units (LPUs), specialized chips designed for AI inference that deliver exceptional speed, quality, and energy efficiency. As of September 2025, Groq has achieved a valuation of $6.9 billion following its latest funding round. The company offers both cloud-based (GroqCloud) and on-premises solutions, serving nearly 2 million developers and teams globally with sub-millisecond latency for AI inference.

products.name: GroqCloud: Cloud-based AI inference platform with OpenAI-compatible API.
GroqRack: On-premises compute clusters with 64-576+ LPUs per rack.
LPU Technology: Deterministic, software-first architecture for AI inference.
Support for open models: Llama, Mixtral, Gemma, DeepSeek, Qwen.
Groq Compiler: Model-independent compilation for instant deployment.

issuers.tagline: AI research lab developing Mathematical Superintelligence (MSI) to eliminate hallucinations and guarantee accuracy through formal mathematical reasoning
issuers.description: Harmonic is an AI research lab founded in 2023 by Vlad Tenev (CEO and co-founder of Robinhood) and Tudor Achim (former CTO of Helm.ai). The company is pioneering Mathematical Superintelligence (MSI), a revolutionary approach to AI that guarantees accuracy and eliminates hallucinations through formal mathematical reasoning. Unlike traditional language-based AI models that rely on probabilistic predictions, Harmonic's flagship model Aristotle uses the Lean4 proof assistant to verify mathematical proofs and ensure correctness. In July 2025, Aristotle achieved gold medal-level performance at the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO), placing it at the forefront of AI mathematical reasoning capabilities. As of November 2025, Harmonic has raised $295 million across three funding rounds in just 14 months, reaching a valuation of $1.45 billion and achieving unicorn status.

products.name: Aristotle: The world's first hallucination-free AI model built on Mathematical Superintelligence.
Lean4 Integration: Uses formal verification to ensure 100% accuracy in mathematical reasoning.
MSI Technology: Replaces probabilistic guesses with provable mathematical solutions.
Aristotle API: Available for developers, mathematicians, and researchers.
Mobile Apps: iOS and Android applications for public access.
Yuclid & Newclid 3.0: Systems for plane geometry problem solving.
MiniF2F Achievement: Achieved 90% success rate on leading formal mathematics benchmark.

issuers.tagline: Domain-specific AI platform transforming legal and professional services with frontier AI
issuers.description: Harvey AI is a pioneering legal technology company founded in 2022 by Winston Weinberg and Gabriel Pereyra. The company specializes in domain-specific artificial intelligence for legal and professional services sectors. Harvey provides AI-powered solutions for tasks such as contract analysis, due diligence, legal research, compliance, and litigation support. Its platform is used by global law firms and Fortune 500 enterprises. As of June 2025, Harvey achieved a $5 billion valuation following a $300 million Series E funding round. The company reached $100 million in annual recurring revenue in August 2025, serving over 500 customers across 54 countries, including 42% of AmLaw 100 firms.

Harvey Vault: Securely store, organize, and bulk-analyze legal documents.

Word Add-In: Draft, edit, and review contracts directly in Microsoft Word.
Custom LLMs: Leverages OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, Mistral, and xAI models.

issuers.tagline: Building the safest generative AI healthcare agents to bring clinical abundance and close the global healthcare worker shortage
issuers.description: Hippocratic AI is the global leader in safety-focused generative AI healthcare agents, founded in 2023 by CEO Munjal Shah alongside physicians, hospital administrators, healthcare professionals, and AI researchers from leading institutions including El Camino Health, Johns Hopkins, Washington University in St. Louis, Stanford, Google, and NVIDIA. The company's mission is to develop the safest Large Language Model for healthcare, bringing clinical abundance to address the growing shortage of 15 million healthcare workers worldwide. Named after the Hippocratic Oath, the company prioritizes "Do No Harm" above all else, focusing exclusively on non-diagnostic, patient-facing clinical tasks. As of November 2025, Hippocratic AI has achieved a $3.5 billion valuation following its Series C round, establishing partnerships with over 50 large health systems, payors, and pharma clients across 6 countries, completing over 115 million patient interactions with zero safety issues.

Medication Checks: Patient education and medication reconciliation services.

Polaris Safety Constellation: Multi-model architecture with 70B-100B parameters trained on evidence-based content.

issuers.tagline: Digital identity verification platform securing access to government services and benefits
issuers.description: ID.me is a leading digital identity verification platform that simplifies how individuals securely prove their identity online. Founded in 2010 by Blake Hall, a decorated Army Ranger, the company has evolved from serving military communities to becoming the trusted identity partner for government agencies, healthcare organizations, and enterprises. ID.me enables users to verify their identity once and seamlessly access services across multiple platforms without repeated verification. As of 2025, the platform serves over 152 million users, including 20 federal agencies, 45 state government agencies, and more than 70 healthcare organizations, preventing billions in fraud while ensuring secure access to critical services.

NIST 800-63-3 IAL2/AAL2 Certified: Meets highest federal security standards.
State Agency Integration: Unemployment benefits, healthcare, and licensing services.
IRS Authentication: Secure access to tax records and transcripts.
Fraud Prevention: Protected $270B+ from identity fraud across government programs.
Multi-Factor Authentication: Video verification and trusted referee options.

issuers.tagline: America's first federally regulated prediction market exchange for trading on real-world events
issuers.description: Kalshi is America's first federally regulated prediction market exchange, founded in 2018 by Tarek Mansour and Luana Lopes Lara. The platform allows users to trade event contracts on real-world outcomes, from political elections and economic indicators to sports, weather, and cultural events. After an 18-month regulatory journey, Kalshi received designation as a contract market from the CFTC in November 2020 and launched its trading platform in July 2021. The company made headlines in October 2024 when a federal appeals court ruled in its favor, allowing it to offer political prediction markets—the first fully regulated election markets in the U.S. As of October 2025, Kalshi has achieved a $5 billion valuation following a $300 million Series D funding round and now operates in over 140 countries. With 2 million users and $50 billion in projected annualized trading volume for 2025, Kalshi is transforming how people hedge risk and capitalize on their knowledge of world events.
highlights: Reached $5B valuation with $300M Series D (Oct 2025).

issuers.description: Kraken was founded in 2011 and has grown into one of the world's most trusted digital asset platforms. It offers spot and margin trading, futures up to 50x, staking, fiat on-ramps in USD, EUR, GBP, JPY, CAD, AUD, CHF, and institutional services. The exchange serves 15M+ clients across 190+ countries and emphasises security with cold storage, mandatory 2FA, PGP encryption, fraud monitoring and recurring Proof of Reserves audits. In Q1 2025, Kraken generated $472M in revenue and $187M in adjusted EBITDA, marking a 19% year-over-year revenue increase. Tracxn Score: 77.95. Unicorn since 2019.

issuers.tagline: Open-source framework and platform for building reliable AI agents with large language models
issuers.description: LangChain is a leading platform for agent engineering founded in October 2022 by Harrison Chase and Ankush Gola. The company's mission is to make AI agents as reliable as databases and APIs. LangChain began as an open-source framework to simplify LLM application development and has evolved into a comprehensive ecosystem with 90+ million monthly downloads and adoption by 35% of Fortune 500 companies. As of October 2025, LangChain has achieved unicorn status with a $1.25 billion valuation following a $125 million Series B funding round led by IVP. With over 118,000 GitHub stars and customers including Replit, Clay, Harvey, Rippling, Cisco, and Workday, LangChain powers the next generation of AI applications.

LangGraph: Open-source framework for building custom, stateful agent workflows with low-level orchestration.

issuers.tagline: Building multimodal general intelligence to generate, understand, and operate in the physical world
issuers.hq: Palo Alto, CA / San Francisco Bay Area
issuers.description: Luma AI is a frontier generative AI lab founded in September 2021 by Amit Jain, Alex Yu, and Alberto Taiuti. The company's mission is to build multimodal general intelligence that can generate, understand, and operate in the physical world. Luma AI started with photorealistic 3D capture technology and has evolved into a leader in AI video generation. Its flagship platform, Dream Machine, enables creatives to generate professional-grade video and images, serving over 30 million users globally. In September 2025, Luma released Ray3, the world's first reasoning video model capable of creating physically accurate videos in true HDR format. The company has raised over $1 billion in funding, with its most recent $900 million Series C round in November 2025 led by HUMAIN (Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund), valuing the company at over $4 billion. Luma AI's models are utilized by top entertainment studios, ad agencies, and technology leaders including Adobe and AWS.

issuers.tagline: AI-powered company transforming the real world with computer vision for checkout-free payment experiences
issuers.description: Metropolis is an artificial intelligence company founded in 2017 by CEO Alex Israel and co-founders Travis Kell, Peter Fisher, and Courtney Fukuda in Santa Monica, California. The company is pioneering the "Recognition Economy" by using computer vision and AI to enable seamless, checkout-free payment experiences in the physical world. Starting with parking, Metropolis has revolutionized the industry by automating vehicle recognition and payment processing, eliminating the need for tickets, cards, or apps. As of November 2025, Metropolis has achieved a $5 billion valuation following a $1.6 billion financing round. The company is now the largest parking operator in North America with over 4,200 locations and operations in 40 countries. Metropolis processes more than $5 billion in annual transactions, serves 50 million customers, and adds over 1 million new members monthly. With 23,000+ employees, Metropolis is rapidly expanding beyond parking into retail, hospitality, fueling, and security sectors.

products.name: Computer Vision Platform: AI-powered system that recognizes vehicles and processes payments automatically without tickets or cards.
Checkout-Free Parking: Seamless "drive in, drive out" experience at 4,200+ locations across North America.
Recognition Technology: Proprietary AI that identifies vehicles by their unique characteristics (vehicle fingerprint).
Enterprise Portal: Intuitive platform for facility management, validations, and operational insights.

issuers.tagline: European AI champion developing open-source large language models and frontier AI systems
issuers.description: Mistral AI is a French artificial intelligence startup founded in April 2023 by three former Google DeepMind and Meta researchers. The company specializes in developing open-weight large language models and has rapidly emerged as Europe's leading AI champion. With its flagship chatbot Le Chat and cutting-edge models like Mistral Large and Mixtral, the company has achieved a $14 billion valuation in just over two years. Mistral AI focuses on making frontier AI accessible, transparent, and aligned with European values while competing globally with Silicon Valley giants.

issuers.tagline: Africa's leading fintech unicorn providing all-in-one banking, payments, and business solutions for SMEs
issuers.description: Moniepoint Inc., formerly known as TeamApt, is a Nigerian fintech unicorn founded in 2015 by Tosin Eniolorunda and Felix Ike. Headquartered in Lagos, Nigeria, with offices in London and Wilmington, Delaware, Moniepoint has become Africa's leading business banking platform serving over 10 million businesses and individuals. The company initially focused on building payment infrastructure for banks before pivoting in 2019 to provide seamless payments, banking, credit, and business management tools directly to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises. As of October 2025, Moniepoint processes over 1 billion transactions monthly worth more than $250 billion annually, making it Nigeria's largest merchant acquirer. The company achieved unicorn status in October 2024 and is one of the few fintechs globally to reach profitability at unicorn scale while driving financial inclusion across Africa.

issuers.tagline: All-in-one corporate travel and expense management platform simplifying business travel
issuers.description: Navan (formerly TripActions) is a corporate travel and expense management platform founded in May 2015 by Ariel Cohen and Ilan Twig in Palo Alto, California. The company provides an integrated solution that combines travel booking, corporate payment cards, expense automation, and real-time analytics. Navan serves over 10,000 customers worldwide including Zoom, Lyft, Unilever, Adobe, Shopify, and Christie's. As of October 2025, Navan is preparing for an IPO on Nasdaq under ticker "NAVN", targeting a valuation of $6.45 billion with plans to raise up to $960 million. The company reported trailing twelve-month revenue of $613 million (up 32% YoY) and gross booking volume of $7.6 billion (up 34% YoY) as of July 2025. Navan's AI assistant Ava resolves over 50% of user interactions, and its Navan Connect technology enables automated expense management across 250+ banks without requiring companies to switch card providers.

issuers.tagline: Cloud security leader delivering SASE and zero trust solutions for the AI era
issuers.description: Netskope is a global SASE leader founded in 2012 that helps organizations apply zero trust principles to protect data and defend against cyber threats. With its flagship Netskope One platform, the company serves over 4,300 customers across 90 countries, including 30+ Fortune 100 companies. issuers.tagline: AI-first autonomy company building the most scalable self-driving technology
issuers.description: Nuro is an American robotics company founded in 2016 by former Google/Waymo engineers Jiajun Zhu and Dave Ferguson. Originally focused on autonomous delivery vehicles, Nuro has pivoted to licensing its advanced Level 4 self-driving technology, the Nuro Driver™, to OEMs and mobility platforms. The company has achieved over 1.4 million autonomous miles with zero at-fault incidents across five years of driverless deployments. In 2025, Nuro partnered with Uber and Lucid to deploy 20,000+ robotaxis globally, marking a major shift from delivery to passenger transport. As of August 2025, the company has raised $2.34 billion and achieved a $6 billion valuation.

issuers.tagline: AI research and deployment company developing artificial general intelligence to benefit humanity
issuers.description: OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company founded in December 2015 by Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, Elon Musk, and others. OpenAI started as a nonprofit research organization with $1 billion in pledged funding and transitioned to a capped-profit model in 2019 to attract additional investment. The company has developed groundbreaking AI systems including GPT-4o, ChatGPT, DALL-E, and Sora. As of October 2025, OpenAI has achieved a valuation of $500 billion following a secondary share sale, making it the world's most valuable private company. With over 800 million weekly active users and $10 billion in annualized revenue, OpenAI leads the global AI industry.

issuers.tagline: Health technology company developing smart rings for sleep, activity, and wellness tracking

issuers.tagline: AI-powered answer engine revolutionizing search with real-time, cited responses

issuers.tagline: World's largest prediction market platform enabling trading on future events
issuers.description: Polymarket is the world's largest prediction market platform, founded in 2020 by Shayne Coplan. Built on the Polygon blockchain, it allows users to trade on the outcomes of real-world events, from politics to sports to economics. The platform gained significant traction during the 2024 US presidential election, processing over $3.3 billion in wagers. As of September 2025, Polymarket is valued at approximately $10 billion and has secured regulatory approval to return to the US market through its acquisition of QCEX, a CFTC-licensed derivatives exchange. The platform demonstrates 94% accuracy in event predictions and serves millions of users globally.

products.name: Prediction Markets: Trade on politics, sports, crypto, and current events.
Event Contracts: Binary options on real-world outcomes with USDC settlement.
Polygon Integration: Built on Polygon blockchain for low fees and fast transactions.
Analytics Platform: Real-time data, leaderboards, and market insights.
Chainlink Partnership: Oracle integration for accurate market resolutions.

highlights: Raised $200M+ at $1B valuation led by Peter Thiel's Founders Fund (June 2025).
Acquired QCEX for $112M to legally operate in the US market (July 2025).
Partnered with Chainlink for oracle-based market resolutions (Sep 2025).
Processed $3.3B in 2024 US presidential election wagers with 94% accuracy.
Donald Trump Jr. joined advisory board via 1789 Capital investment.
Reached 314,500 active traders in December 2024 (all-time high).
Partnership with Elon Musk's xAI as official prediction market partner.
Nate Silver joined as advisor to enhance prediction methodology.

issuers.tagline: Open-source product analytics platform for building successful products
issuers.description: PostHog is an open-source product analytics platform founded in 2020 by James Hawkins and Tim Glaser during Y Combinator's W20 batch. The company provides a comprehensive suite of tools for product engineers, including analytics, session replay, feature flags, A/B testing, and more. With a unique approach of transparency, generous free tiers, and no sales pressure, PostHog has grown to serve over 190,000 customers, including 65% of Y Combinator companies. The platform raised $70M in Series D funding led by Stripe at a $920M valuation in June 2025.

products.name: Product Analytics: Event-based analytics with auto-capture and SQL analysis.
Session Replay: Watch real user sessions to understand behavior.
Feature Flags: Safely roll out features to specific users or cohorts.
A/B Testing & Experiments: Test changes with statistical rigor.
Surveys: Collect user feedback with no-code templates.
Web Analytics: GA-like dashboard for traffic and conversions.
Data Warehouse & CDP: Single source of truth for customer data.
Max AI: AI assistant for insights and automation (beta).
Error Tracking & LLM Observability: Monitor and fix issues.

highlights: Raised $70M Series D at $920M valuation, led by Stripe (June 2025).
Achieved 15.7% MoM growth for 12 months with 5-day CAC payback period.
Launched Max AI for automated insights and code generation.
Expanded to 10+ products from initial product analytics offering.
Reached 190,000+ customers with 98% using the platform for free.
Released data warehouse, CDP, and ETL functionality.
Maintained profitability trajectory while cutting prices for customers.
65% of Y Combinator batch companies now use PostHog.

issuers.tagline: Building the world's first utility-scale fault-tolerant quantum computer using photonic qubits
issuers.description: PsiQuantum is a quantum computing company founded in 2016 by four academics from the University of Bristol and Imperial College London. The company is developing a general-purpose silicon photonic quantum computer with the ambitious goal of building the world's first commercially useful, fault-tolerant quantum computer with one million qubits. As of September 2025, PsiQuantum has raised $1.8 billion in total funding, including a $1 billion Series E round that valued the company at $7 billion. The company is building utility-scale quantum computing facilities in Brisbane, Australia (operational by end of 2027) and Chicago, Illinois (2028), with substantial government backing from both locations.

products.name: Omega Chipset: Silicon photonic quantum computing platform manufactured at scale.
Photonic Qubits: Using single photons as qubits for quantum information processing.
Fusion-Based Quantum Computing (FBQC): Architecture for scalable quantum systems.
Barium Titanate (BTO): Ultra-high-performance electro-optic material for optical switches.
Cryogenic Cooling: Modular datacenter-style cooling solution at 2-4K temperature.
Quantum Networking: Long-range chip-to-chip interconnects using telecom fiber.

highlights: Raised $1B Series E at $7B valuation led by BlackRock, Temasek, Baillie Gifford (Sep 2025).
Announced Omega chipset with Nature publication demonstrating 99.98% fidelity (Feb 2025).
Secured A$940M from Australian governments for Brisbane quantum facility (Apr 2024).
Partnered with Illinois for $760M Chicago quantum computing park (Jul 2024).
Strategic collaboration with NVIDIA on GPU-QPU integration and algorithms.
Selected for DARPA US2QC program phase 2 funding.
Partnership with Linde Engineering for large-scale cryogenic plants.
MOU with five Queensland universities for quantum education programs.

issuers.tagline: AI-powered aerial intelligence systems delivering autonomous eVTOL drones for defense, security, and commercial applications
issuers.description: Quantum Systems is a German technology company founded in January 2015 by Florian Seibel, a former Bundeswehr officer and aerospace researcher. Headquartered in Gilching near Munich, the company specializes in developing AI-powered electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) unmanned aerial systems (UAS) for both defense and commercial applications. Originally focused on agricultural and mapping drones, Quantum Systems pivoted toward dual-use technology following Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022, becoming a critical supplier of reconnaissance drones to Ukraine and NATO allies. The company's flagship Vector drone has become essential in modern defense operations, with production facilities in Germany, Ukraine, Australia, and Romania. In November 2025, Quantum Systems achieved a valuation of €3 billion ($3.5 billion) following a €180 million funding round, tripling its valuation in just six months and establishing itself as Europe's leading defense technology company.

products.name: Vector: Tactical ISR eVTOL drone with 120-minute flight time and 15km+ range
Vector AI: Advanced reconnaissance drone with dual AI chips for target tracking and swarm coordination
Trinity F90+: Professional large-scale mapping drone with 90-minute flight time
Scorpion: Tactical tri-copter configuration sharing Vector's fuselage for rapid deployment
Jaeger: Counter-drone system designed to detect, track, and neutralize hostile UAVs
Sparta & Reliant: Mothership drones designed for drone carrier operations

Opened production facility in Ukraine producing 40-80 Vector drones monthly

issuers.tagline: AI-powered financial operations platform transforming corporate spend management and saving businesses time and money
issuers.description: Ramp is a leading financial operations platform founded in March 2019 by Eric Glyman, Karim Atiyeh, and Gene Lee. Headquartered in New York City, Ramp has revolutionized corporate spend management through its AI-powered platform that combines corporate cards, expense management, bill payments, procurement, and automated bookkeeping. The company's mission is to help businesses save time and money by automating financial operations and providing intelligent insights. As of November 2025, Ramp has achieved a valuation of $32 billion following a $300 million funding round, marking a remarkable 146% increase from its July 2025 valuation of $22.5 billion. With over 50,000 customers and processing more than $100 billion in annual purchases, Ramp has become one of the fastest-growing fintechs in the United States, challenging incumbents like American Express and SAP Concur.

products.name: Corporate Cards: Up to 1.5% cashback with intelligent spend controls and no fees.
Expense Management: AI-powered automation with 50+ policy audits and real-time tracking.
Bill Pay: Automated invoice processing and payment workflows in minutes.
Procurement: End-to-end purchasing with intake, approvals, and vendor management.
Treasury: High-yield business accounts earning 2.5% on idle cash.
Travel Booking: Integrated with Priceline for corporate travel management.
AI Agents: Autonomous controllers and AP agents for financial automation.

highlights: Achieved $32B valuation, up 42% from July 2025 (Nov 2025).
Raised $300M in Series F led by Lightspeed Venture Partners.
Surpassed $1 billion in annualized revenue with positive free cash flow.

issuers.tagline: Creating a circular supply chain for electric vehicles and clean energy
Building superintelligent autonomous AI systems with frontier open intelligence models
issuers.description: Reflection AI is a frontier AI startup founded in March 2024 by former Google DeepMind researchers Misha Laskin and Ioannis Antonoglou. The company is developing superintelligent autonomous systems with a focus on open-source AI models that rival closed systems like OpenAI and DeepSeek. Reflection AI has assembled a world-class team of former DeepMind, OpenAI, and Anthropic engineers who previously built breakthrough systems including AlphaGo, AlphaZero, and Gemini. In October 2025, the company raised $2 billion at an $8 billion valuation, marking a remarkable 15x increase from its $545 million valuation just seven months prior. Reflection AI's research sits at the intersection of large language models and reinforcement learning, aiming to create the most capable and reliable AI agents for enterprise applications.

products.name: Asimov: Code research agent that understands complex codebases and engineering systems
Coding Agent API: Automates routine engineering tasks and rote coding work
Frontier LLM Platform: Large-scale reinforcement learning platform for training Mixture-of-Experts models
Open Model Weights: Releasing model parameters for public use while maintaining proprietary training pipelines
Autonomous Systems: AI agents capable of multi-step planning and execution in real-world environments
Enterprise Solutions: Contextualized AI oracles with deep company knowledge

highlights: Raised $2B at $8B valuation led by NVIDIA (Oct 2025)
Valuation increased 15x from $545M to $8B in seven months
Assembled elite team of 60+ AI researchers from DeepMind, OpenAI, Anthropic

issuers.tagline: AI-powered platform enabling anyone to build software through natural language
issuers.description: Replit is an AI-powered software creation platform founded in 2016 by Amjad Masad, Haya Odeh, and Faris Masad. It revolutionizes software development by enabling anyone to build applications using natural language through its flagship Replit Agent. As of September 2025, Replit has achieved a $3 billion valuation following its $250 million funding round. The company serves over 30 million users globally and generates $150 million in annual recurring revenue, having grown 10x from $10M to $100M ARR in just 5.5 months between late 2024 and mid-2025.

Collaborative coding: Real-time multiplayer editing like Google Docs for code.

issuers.tagline: Global fintech leader providing digital banking, payments, and financial services to 65M+ customers worldwide
issuers.description: Revolut is a global financial technology company founded in July 2015 by Nikolay Storonsky and Vlad Yatsenko in London. The company started as a digital-first alternative to traditional banking, initially offering a prepaid card and multi-currency exchange at interbank rates. Today, Revolut has evolved into a comprehensive financial super-app serving over 65 million customers across 48+ countries. As of November 2025, the company achieved a valuation of $75 billion, making it Europe's most valuable private technology company. Revolut offers a full suite of banking services including multi-currency accounts supporting 120+ currencies, debit and credit cards, stock trading, cryptocurrency exchange, insurance, peer-to-peer payments, and business banking solutions. The company reported remarkable financial performance in 2024 with $4 billion in revenue (up 72% year-over-year) and $1.4 billion in profit before tax (up 149%). With banking licenses secured in multiple jurisdictions including the UK, EU, Mexico, Colombia, and India, Revolut is pursuing its ambitious vision to become the world's first truly global bank serving 100 million customers across 100 countries by 2027.

issuers.tagline: AI-powered workflow documentation platform that turns any process into step-by-step guides
issuers.description: Scribe is a workflow AI platform founded in 2019 by Jennifer Smith and Aaron Podolny that helps organizations document and scale how work gets done. The platform automatically captures user actions and generates step-by-step guides complete with screenshots and instructions, eliminating manual documentation. Scribe's flagship product, Scribe Capture, records any digital process and creates beautiful documentation in seconds. In November 2025, Scribe announced its $75 million Series C funding round at a $1.3 billion valuation, bringing total funding to $130 million. The company is rolling out Scribe Optimize, a new platform that maps enterprise workflows to reveal where AI and automation will deliver measurable returns. With over 5 million users across 78,000 paying organizations, including 94% of Fortune 500 companies, Scribe has documented more than 10 million workflows across 40,000 software applications.

issuers.tagline: AI startup developing conversational AI agents for enterprise customer service
issuers.description: Sierra is an AI startup founded in 2023 by former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor and Google executive Clay Bavor. It focuses on building conversational AI agents that transform customer experiences for enterprises, providing always-available, empathetic support across channels. The company emphasizes trust, security, and compliance in its AI solutions. As of September 2025, Sierra has achieved a valuation of $10 billion following its latest funding round. It serves hundreds of customers, including SoFi, Ramp, Brex, and ADT, and generates over $100 million in annual recurring revenue.

products.name: Conversational AI agents: Empathetic, brand-aligned agents for customer support.

The world's leading AI video communications platform for enterprises, creating professional videos using AI avatars and text
issuers.description: Synthesia is a British multinational AI company based in London that develops software for creating AI-generated video content. Founded in 2017 by Victor Riparbelli, Steffen Tjerrild, Professor Matthias Niessner, and Professor Lourdes Agapito from UCL, Stanford, TUM, and Cambridge, Synthesia's mission is to empower everyone to make video content without cameras, microphones, or studios. The company's software algorithm mimics speech and facial movements based on video recordings to create text-to-speech videos that look and sound like real individuals. As of January 2025, Synthesia has achieved a valuation of $2.1 billion and serves over 65,000 businesses, including more than 70% of the Fortune 100 companies. With over $100 million in annual recurring revenue and 500+ employees globally, Synthesia leads the enterprise AI video communications market.

products.name: Synthesia STUDIO: Browser-based platform for creating professional AI-generated videos from text.
Expressive Avatars: 230+ realistic AI avatars with natural emotions and facial expressions.
Personal Avatars: Custom digital twins created from webcam or phone recordings.
Video Agents: Interactive AI avatars for training, roleplays, and knowledge checks.
AI Dubbing: Instant video translation and dubbing across 140+ languages.
AI Screen Recorder: Chrome extension for creating professional screen recordings.
AI Video Assistant: Converts documents and web pages into videos automatically.

highlights: Reached $100M+ ARR milestone (Apr 2025), 300% increase from 2023.

issuers.tagline: Digital business banking platform transforming SME financial services globally
issuers.description: Tide is a UK-based financial technology company providing mobile-first banking services for small and medium-sized enterprises. Founded in 2015, it has become the UK's leading business financial platform with 14% market share. The company offers business current accounts, invoicing, accounting integration, expense management, and credit facilities through a comprehensive digital platform. As of September 2025, Tide achieved a $1.5 billion valuation following a $120 million funding round led by TPG. With over 1.6 million members globally, including 800,000 in the UK and 800,000+ in India, Tide is rapidly expanding internationally.

products.name: Business current accounts: Mobile-first banking with Mastercard debit cards.
Invoicing platform: Create, send, and track invoices with payment links.
Tide Accounting: Built-in accounting with VAT returns and Self Assessment.
Expense Cards: Team cards with real-time expense management.
Tide Payroll: HMRC-recognised payroll software (via Onfolk acquisition).
Business credit: Access to loans from £1,000 to £20 million.

issuers.tagline: The Business AI Company – Leading Enterprise AI & Conversational Automation Platform
issuers.hq: Palo Alto, CA (Dual HQ: Chennai, India)
issuers.description: Uniphore is a leading B2B AI-native company providing the Business AI Cloud platform. Founded in 2008 by Umesh Sachdev and Ravi Saraogi, and headquartered in Palo Alto, California (with a dual HQ in Chennai, India), the company enables businesses to rapidly adopt, significantly transform, and immediately unlock value through AI. With a multimodal architecture combining Generative AI, Knowledge AI, Emotion AI, and Workflow Automation, Uniphore helps organizations deploy agentic AI across every enterprise function while ensuring data sovereignty and security. As of October 2025, Uniphore has achieved unicorn status with a $2.5 billion valuation and has raised over $987 million in total funding.

Zero Data AI Cloud: Enables AI deployment without data migration, maintaining data sovereignty and security.

Serving 2,000+ global businesses including Dell, The Washington Post, Atlassian, KPMG.

Named to Forbes AI 50 list and World Economic Forum Innovator Community.
Deep partnership with NVIDIA, AMD, Snowflake, Databricks for AI infrastructure.

issuers.tagline: AI-first community association management platform transforming HOA operations with cutting-edge automation
issuers.description: Vantaca is the leading AI-first community association management platform founded in 2016 by Dave Sweyer and David Gunn in Wilmington, North Carolina. The company provides comprehensive business operating software for community association management companies, serving over 500 management companies and 6 million households nationwide. Vantaca has revolutionized the HOA management industry through its modern cloud architecture, single-platform design, and AI-powered automation. In October 2025, Vantaca achieved a $1.25 billion valuation following a $300+ million growth investment led by Cove Hill Partners, with participation from existing investor JMI Equity. The company has been recognized on the Inc. 5000 list for five consecutive years and achieved 95% revenue growth in the past year. With the strategic acquisition of HOAi in November 2024, Vantaca now offers both Scout everyday AI and HOAi transformational AI capabilities, positioning itself as the category-defining leader in AI-driven community management.

Vantaca IQ: Business intelligence solution built exclusively for community association management.
Banking Integration: Full integration with leading industry banks for real-time financial operations.

issuers.tagline: Pioneering Embodied AI for autonomous driving with end-to-end deep learning technology
issuers.description: Wayve is a British autonomous driving technology company founded in 2017 by Alex Kendall and Amar Shah, two machine learning PhD students from the University of Cambridge. The company pioneers Embodied AI for self-driving vehicles, using end-to-end deep learning that enables vehicles to learn from experience rather than relying on detailed maps or hand-coded rules. Unlike traditional autonomous vehicle systems that depend on expensive LiDAR sensors and high-definition maps, Wayve's approach uses primarily camera data and AI that can adapt to new environments without geofenced limits. The company was the first to deploy end-to-end deep learning autonomous vehicles on public roads. Headquartered in London with offices in California, Vancouver, Germany, and Japan, Wayve has raised over $1.3 billion from investors including SoftBank, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Uber. The company is currently in talks to raise an additional $2 billion at an $8 billion valuation. Wayve's vision is to create a "general purpose" driving AI that can power all levels of automation in any vehicle, anywhere in the world.

issuers.tagline: The largest livestream shopping platform connecting buyers and sellers in real-time across collectibles, fashion, sneakers, and 250+ categories
issuers.description: Whatnot is the largest livestream shopping platform in the United States, United Kingdom, and Europe, founded in 2019 by Grant LaFontaine and Logan Head. The platform revolutionizes e-commerce by combining live video auctions, community engagement, and entertainment to create an interactive shopping experience. Whatnot connects millions of buyers and sellers in real-time across over 250 categories, including collectibles like trading cards, comic books, sports memorabilia, Funko Pops, as well as fashion, sneakers, beauty products, electronics, plants, and vintage items. As of October 2025, Whatnot has achieved a valuation of $11.5 billion following a $225 million Series F funding round, more than doubling its valuation since January 2025. The platform hosts over 175,000 hours of livestreams weekly and has facilitated over $6 billion in gross merchandise value in 2025 alone, more than twice its total for all of 2024.

issuers.tagline: Advanced nuclear reactor and fuel technology developer pioneering safe, carbon-free energy solutions with small modular reactors

fundingRounds.valuation: Jane Street, ARK Invest, Galvanize, Hood River Capital, Point72, Reaves Asset Management, XTX Ventures
Amazon Climate Pledge Fund, Ken Griffin (Citadel), Ares Management, NGP, University of Michigan

issuers.lastRoundValuation: Jane Street, ARK Invest, Galvanize, Hood River Capital, Point72, Reaves Asset Management, XTX Ventures
issuers.description: X-energy is a pioneering American nuclear technology company founded in 2009 by entrepreneur and engineer Dr. Kam Ghaffarian. The company specializes in developing advanced small modular reactors and proprietary nuclear fuel technology to deliver safe, affordable, and carbon-free energy. X-energy's flagship product, the Xe-100, is a Generation IV high-temperature gas-cooled pebble-bed reactor capable of producing 80 megawatts of electrical power per unit. The reactor operates using X-energy's innovative TRISO-X fuel, which seals uranium particles in protective coating to make nuclear meltdowns impossible. With over $1.8 billion in total funding and partnerships with major corporations including Amazon, Dow, and Centrica, X-energy has secured an impressive orderbook of more than 11 gigawatts representing approximately 144 small modular reactors. The company is building North America's first commercial TRISO-X fuel fabrication facility in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, and has received significant support from the U.S. Department of Energy's Advanced Reactor Demonstration Program.

products.name: Xe-100 Reactor: Fourth-generation high-temperature gas-cooled small modular reactor producing 80 MW per unit.
TRISO-X Fuel: Proprietary fuel technology using spherical pebbles with 20% enriched uranium in protective coating.
Modular Design: Road-transportable reactor modules enabling rapid deployment and cost control.
60-Year Lifespan: Continuous operation without fuel interruption for six decades.
Multi-Unit Plants: Scalable configurations from 320 MW to 960 MW four-pack installations.
Fuel Fabrication Facility: First-in-nation TRISO-X fuel manufacturing plant in Oak Ridge, Tennessee.
Process Heat Applications: Flexible design for both electricity generation and industrial heat needs.

highlights: Raised $700M Series D led by Jane Street with participation from ARK Invest (Nov 2025).
Secured 11 GW orderbook representing approximately 144 SMR units.
Amazon invested $500M and committed to 5+ GW deployment by 2039 (Oct 2024).
Partnership with Energy Northwest for 320-960 MW project in Washington State.
Agreement with Dow Inc. for four-unit Xe-100 plant at Texas Gulf Coast facility.
Centrica partnership to deploy 6 GW of capacity in the United Kingdom.
Began vertical construction of TRISO-X fuel fabrication facility in Oak Ridge.
Strategic partnership with Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power and Doosan Enerbility.

issuers.tagline: Advanced artificial intelligence company developing truth-seeking AI systems to understand the universe
issuers.description: xAI is an artificial intelligence company founded by Elon Musk in March 2023 with the mission to understand the true nature of the universe through advanced AI systems. The company develops maximally truth-seeking AI that aims to benefit all of humanity. xAI's flagship product is Grok, an AI chatbot with a rebellious streak that has access to real-time information from the X platform. In March 2025, xAI acquired X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction that valued X at $33 billion and xAI at $80 billion, combining the two companies into X.AI Holdings Corp. The company operates the world's largest AI supercomputer, Colossus, in Memphis, Tennessee, which was built in just 122 days and now runs on over 200,000 Nvidia GPUs. As of September 2025, xAI has achieved a valuation of $200 billion following a $10 billion funding round, making it one of the most valuable AI startups in the world.

products.name: Grok 4.1: State-of-the-art AI chatbot with advanced reasoning and lower hallucination rates.
Grok 4 Fast: Cost-efficient reasoning model with 2M token context window.
Grok 3: Advanced model with Think Mode for extended reasoning (93.3% on AIME 2025).
Grok Voice: Natural voice conversation capabilities for seamless dialogue.
Colossus Supercomputer: World's largest AI training cluster with 200K+ GPUs.
xAI API: Developer platform for integrating Grok models into applications.
DeepSearch: Enhanced search capabilities with extended reasoning and real-time data.

highlights: Achieved $200B valuation in $10B funding round (Sep 2025).
Launched Grok 4.1 with improved reasoning and reduced hallucinations.
Acquired X (Twitter) for $33B in all-stock transaction (Mar 2025).
Expanded Colossus to 200K GPUs, planning scale to 1M GPUs.
Built Colossus 2 data center in Memphis (1GW capacity in development).
Raised $10B in debt and equity at $150B valuation (Jul 2025).
Launched Grok 3 with Think Mode and 128K token context window.
Received $200M DoD contract for AI in military applications.
Released Aurora text-to-image model and Grok Imagine video generation.
Built world's largest supercomputer in record 122 days.
